content.question: An equimolar mixture of <math alttext="X gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>X</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="Y gas" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>Y</mtext> <mo>(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> is placed inside a rigid container at constant temperature. The particle diagram above represents the changes that occur over time. Based on the particle diagram, which of the following best predicts whether or not the system has reached equilibrium by <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: It is not possible to determine that the system has reached equilibrium by <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the stoichiometry of the reaction is not known.

It is not possible to determine that the system has reached equilibrium by <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the amounts of <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have continued to change.

The system has reached equilibrium by <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the rate of formation of <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is constant.

The system has reached equilibrium by <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the rates of consumption of <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are equal.

content.answer: It is not possible to determine that the system has reached equilibrium by <math alttext="300 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>300</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> because the amounts of <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Y</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="X Y" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>XY</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> have continued to change.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
